channel.title: How to change player rights to make a co-owner number
channel.description:
how would i make it so 0 = normal 1 = mod 2 = admin 3 = co-owner 4 = owner
and if you can tell me how to fix this on utorrent
[code][2009-03-19 16:37:04] UPnP: Unable to map port 192.168.1.3:43594 with UPnP. and [2009-03-19 16:36:45] TCP port bind failed 0.0.0.0:43594: (10048) Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port) is normally permitted. [/code] you dont have to if you want it off tell me ill edit it out

item.title: How to change player rights to make a co-owner number
item.dc:creator: @demonnd demonnd
item.source: How to change player rights to make a co-owner number

item.title: How to change player rights to make a co-owner number
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:10, topic:268381”][quote author=Darkning link=topic=354198.msg2713770#msg2713770 date=1237499308]
I don’t know how to do this. Maybe use the search bar and try google.
[/quote]
I’m sorry, not to be rude, how do you have 53 rep? (I guess rep really doesn’t mean anything anymore.

Anyway the crowns are client-sided. And everything else is depending what you want to do.
Example, if you want only co-owner and owner only use:

if (command.startsWith("lalla") && (playerRights > 2)) {

owner only:

if (command.startsWith("lalla") && (playerRights > 3)) { [br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 19, 2009, 03:54:50 pm[/size][hr]Let me add to that,

Mod:

&& (playerRights => 1))

Admin

&& (playerRights => 2))

Co-owner

&& (playerRights => 3))

owner:

&& (playerRights => 4)) [/quote]
You’re giving him the client sided crowns, when he is asking for a way to change what player right each integer gives.

“I’m sorry to be rude, but how do you have 30 rep?”

Read full topic
item.source: How to change player rights to make a co-owner number

Darkning:

I don’t know how to do this. Maybe use the search bar and try google.

I’m sorry, not to be rude, how do you have 53 rep? (I guess rep really doesn’t mean anything anymore.

Anyway the crowns are client-sided. And everything else is depending what you want to do.
Example, if you want only co-owner and owner only use:

if (command.startsWith("lalla") && (playerRights > 2)) {

owner only:

if (command.startsWith("lalla") && (playerRights > 3)) { [br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 19, 2009, 03:54:50 pm[/size][hr]Let me add to that,

Mod:

&& (playerRights => 1))

Admin

&& (playerRights => 2))

Co-owner

&& (playerRights => 3))

&& (playerRights => 4))
